comments:
Within one workbench session with TPTP, I had created many test suites, 
artifacts and test-related elements.  After creating about 25+ new artifacts 
going through the wizards and performing finish, I received an SWT no more 
handles error.  It appears that the following code in 
EObjectResourceLabelProvider.java code creates an image instance--this error 
might occur if SWT images are created and not disposed of properly.  The 
solution is usually to call dispose on the created image instances after the 
wizard has completed (Looking at the code I don't see any of the test code 
calling the dipose method on EObjectResourceLabelProvider.java).  By the way, 
here is more information on disposing images with SWT in Eclipse:

http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-Using%20Images%20In%20Eclipse/Using%
20Images%20In%20Eclipse.html

	public Image getImage(Object element)
	{
		if((!useImages) || (element == null))
			return null;

		if (element instanceof IAdaptable)
		{
			IWorkbenchAdapter adapter =
				(IWorkbenchAdapter)((IAdaptable)
element).getAdapter(IWorkbenchAdapter.class);

			if(adapter != null)
				return adapter.getImageDescriptor
(element).createImage();
		}

		if(this.image != null)
			return image;

		return null;			
	}

No more handles

Images are created only once and kept in cache. Then the dispose process is
called  for each image.

Images are created only once and kept in cache. Then the dispose process is
called  for each image in cache.
Setting target based on last change date. Please adjust if this is incorrect

Closing by default since not closed by the originator in the 7+ months since being resolved.  

Please reopen if the issue is still present in the latest TPTP release or the resolution is not correct.
